net.gree.asdk.api
Class ScreenShot

java.lang.Object
  net.gree.asdk.api.ScreenShot

public final class ScreenShot
extends java.lang.Object

This is class used to take screenshots.

Author:
GREE, Inc.

Nested Class Summary
static class ScreenShot.OpenGlRenderer
          Use this class if you want to implement your own drawToCanvas method, otherwise you can just use Screenshot.defaultGlRenderer.
static interface ScreenShot.SurfaceViewRenderer
          This is an interface for the Screenshot api in case you are using a SurfaceView.
 
Field Summary
static ScreenShot.OpenGlRenderer defaultGlRenderer
          This is the default OpenGlRenderer.

          This is the method you need to call in case you are overriding the default ScreenshotButton.
static boolean needSurfaceViewScreenShot()
          return true if the next call to takeSurfaceViewScreenShot method will take a screenshot.
static boolean takeSurfaceViewScreenShot(ScreenShot.SurfaceViewRenderer renderer, int viewId)
          This must be called in your GLSurfaceView.Renderer.onDrawFrame(GL10 gl) This method will call the renderer.drawToCanvas method when a screenshot has been requested.

Field Detail

defaultGlRenderer

public static ScreenShot.OpenGlRenderer defaultGlRenderer
This is the default OpenGlRenderer. You can use this if you are using an GlSurfaceView. make sure to call defaultGlRenderer.setGL in your GlSurfaceView.renderer.onSurfaceCreated(GL10 gl, EGLConfig config);

Constructor Detail

ScreenShot

public ScreenShot()
Method Detail

needSurfaceViewScreenShot

public static boolean needSurfaceViewScreenShot()
return true if the next call to takeSurfaceViewScreenShot method will take a screenshot.

takeSurfaceViewScreenShot

public static boolean takeSurfaceViewScreenShot(ScreenShot.SurfaceViewRenderer renderer,
                                                int viewId)
This must be called in your GLSurfaceView.Renderer.onDrawFrame(GL10 gl) This method will call the renderer.drawToCanvas method when a screenshot has been requested.

Parameters:
renderer - the SurfaceViewRenderer to be used
viewId - the SurfaceView ressource id that you defined in your xml layout file.
Returns:
true if a screenshot has been taken, false otherwise

capture

public static Bitmap capture(View view)
This is the method you need to call in case you are overriding the default ScreenshotButton. Be aware that if the root view you are passing contains a SurfaceView or GlSurfaceView, you need to use the takeSurfaceViewScreenShot in your onDraw method.
